facts.text: Father of the first respondent owned three pieces of land bearing Survey Nos. 93, 102/3 and 125/1 in village Chikhlod, Taluka Kapadvanj, District Kaira.
On June 9, 1933, father of first respondent sold the lands by oral vardi to respondent No. 2 for Rs. 2,701 but continued in possession.
On April 7, 1934, 2nd respondent sold the lands to 1st appellant by oral vardi for Rs. 2,521 and 1st appellant got possession.
In partition of 1st appellant's joint family, Survey No. 93 went to 2nd appellant, remaining to 1st appellant.
Appellants in possession of lands from April 7, 1934.

On August 3, 1945, 1st respondent filed application before Debt Adjustment Board under s.17 r/w s.18 and s.45 of Bombay Agricultural Debtors Relief Act, 1939, against 2nd respondent only. Claim: father had money dealings with 2nd respondent, sold lands in 1933 in consideration of past debts by oral sale with condition of reconveyance.
2nd respondent denied money dealings with father of 1st respondent and stated lands not in his possession.
On December 4, 1945, 1st respondent applied to add appellants as parties; 1st appellant added.
On April 29, 1947, Board held sales to 2nd respondent and appellants invalid, directed 2nd respondent to render accounts.
On May 27, 1947, Bombay Agricultural Debtors Relief Act, 1947 (new Act) came into force, repealing 1939 Act (repealed Act); Boards dissolved.
2nd respondent appealed Board's order to District Judge, Nadiad.
On April 14, 1949, District Judge, Kaira set aside Board's order, remanded to Civil Judge, Kapadvanj to decide nature of transaction afresh.
On April 24, 1950, 1st respondent applied to add 2nd appellant as party; allowed on August 21, 1950.
On September 29, 1953, Civil Judge dismissed petition as not maintainable; District Judge allowed appeal, remanded.
Appellants and 2nd respondent's revision to High Court summarily rejected.
After remand, Civil Judge held transaction not mortgage, appellants acquired title by adverse possession.
On October 16, 1958, District Judge held mortgage subsisted, no title by adverse possession, remanded for debt adjustment.
Gujarat High Court in Civil Revision Application No. 158 of 1960 confirmed District Judge's order dated January 10, 1962.
From April 7, 1934 to August 3, 1945, appellants in possession for less than 12 years. No proof that 1st respondent in possession as tenant from June 9, 1933 to April 7, 1934.

legal_issues.text: Whether Debt Adjustment Board/Civil Judge had jurisdiction to add appellants as parties after limitation period under repealed Act (s.17: within 18 months, by Oct 31, 1945), and whether new Act affects vested rights.
Whether appellants acquired title to lands by adverse possession.

petitioner_arguments.text: Under repealed Act, no application filed against appellants before Oct 31, 1945; adding 1st appellant on Dec 4, 1945 and 2nd on Aug 21, 1950 without jurisdiction, void; vested interest acquired, new Act does not affect.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Bombay Agricultural Debtors Relief Act 1939 s.17, s.7; new Act s.56(2)

petitioner_arguments.text: Appellants acquired right to lands by adverse possession; application to investigate transaction not competent.
Benefit under s.55(6)(b) Transfer of Property Act available only to buyer under valid transaction, not void one.

respondent_arguments.text: Transaction was sale in consideration of past debts with condition of reconveyance, i.e., mortgage; debt liable to adjustment.

court_reasoning.text: Under repealed Act s.17, application within 18 months; s.7 powers like CPC to add parties. New Act s.56(2) provisos deem pending proceedings (original/appeal) under new Act; s.46 allows adding parties post-limitation via O.1 r.10 CPC even after s.4 date.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Proceedings pending at new Act commencement continued as under new Act; jurisdiction to add parties valid.

court_reasoning.text: Application filed timely against 2nd respondent; 1st appellant added by Board pre-new Act, 2nd post-remand; appeal pending at new Act force, disposed under new Act provisions.
Possession from Apr 7, 1934 to Aug 3, 1945 <12 years; no proof of tenancy June 1933-Apr 1934 to tack on.
court_reasoning.key_observation: High Court/District Judge finding: appellants failed to prove tenancy; no adverse possession title.

holdings.text: Orders adding appellants as parties valid under new Act; no jurisdictional defect.
Appellants did not acquire title by adverse possession.

precedents_cited.case_name: Vishwanath Mahadev Adhikari v. Krishnaji Ramchandra Bodas
precedents_cited.relevance: Provisos to s.56(2) new Act retrospective; pending appeals disposed under new Act provisions.
Provisos to s.56(2) give retrospective effect to all new Act provisions, substantive and procedural.
s.46 new Act allows adding parties without consideration of delay.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Agricultural Debtors Relief Act, 1939
statutes_cited.relevance: Application for debt adjustment within 18 months; Board powers to add parties like CPC.

statutes_cited.name: Bombay Agricultural Debtors Relief Act, 1947
statutes_cited.relevance: Repeal of 1939 Act; pending proceedings deemed under new Act; power to add parties post-limitation.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure, 1908
statutes_cited.relevance: Power to add/strike parties; applies to proceedings under new Act.

statutes_cited.name: Transfer of Property Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Benefit to buyer under valid transaction only (point not considered).

statutes_cited.name: Indian Limitation Act, 1877
statutes_cited.relevance: Proceedings against added party deemed to begin on summons service.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed; High Court order confirmed holding 1st respondent a debtor, directing adjustment of debt under Bombay Agricultural Debtors Relief Act; no jurisdiction defect, no adverse possession.
outcome.relief_granted: Debt adjustment to proceed before Civil Judge, Kapadvanj.

key_quotes.text: "the appeal Court is asked to treat the appeals as if the new Act was in force and not the old Act, and in disposing of those appeals the appeal Court has to consider the substantive law as well as the procedural law brought into force by Act XXVIII of 1947."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains retrospective effect of s.56(2) provisos from cited precedent.

key_quotes.text: "From April 7, 1934 to August 3, 1945 the appellants were in possession of the disputed lands and the said period of occupation of the lands by the appellants was less than 12 years."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Key to rejecting adverse possession claim.
